result.execSummary:
Joseph O Smith was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Joseph O Smith was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of Original Waiver with Waiver of Extradition filed by Waukesha County Sheriff's Department, advising that the State of Illinois took the defendant into custody on October 27, 2015.

Waiver of Extradition.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/19/15.

Warrant for Commitment.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/19/15.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph O Smith in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   
State of Illinios is requesting extradition.

Defendant waives extradition.
Court addressed the defendant right to a waiver of hearing or a contested hearing.
Defendant doesn't wish to contest the extradition.
Court accepts/approves the defendant's waiver of extradition.
Court Signed Waiver of Extradition and Order for Commitment.
State of Illinios is to be notified for transport.
Bail is revoked.

If defendant is not picked up by the next court date, the court will readdress bail.  Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joseph O Smith in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
